memberdef.type: QMap< QString, QMap< QgsFeatureId, QList< QgsGeometryCheck::Change > > >
memberdef.name: Changes

briefdescription.para: A collection of changes.

detaileddescription.para: Grouped by layer id and feature id.

briefdescription.para: Something has been added.
Something has been removed.
Something has been updated.
Description of the type of a change.
This change happens on feature level.
This change happens on part level.
This change happens on ring level.
This change happens on node level.
Description of a change to indicate at which level a change occurred.
The check controls individual nodes.
The check controls geometries as a whole.
The check controls a whole layer (topology checks)
The type of a check.
This geometry check should be available in layer validation on the vector layer peroperties.
Flags for geometry checks.
Create a new geometry check.
Returns the check type.

memberdef.argsstring: (const QMap< QString, QgsFeaturePool *> &featurePools, QList< QgsGeometryCheckError *> &errors, QStringList &messages, QgsFeedback *feedback, const LayerFeatureIds &ids=QgsGeometryCheck::LayerFeatureIds()) const =0
memberdef.name: collectErrors

briefdescription.para: The main worker method.

detaileddescription.para: Check all features available from featurePools and write errors found to errors. Other status messages can be written to messages. Progress should be reported to feedback. Only features and layers listed in ids should be checked.

briefdescription.para: A list of geometry types for which this check can be performed.
Returns the configuration value with the name, saved in the QGIS settings for this geometry check.

detaileddescription.para: If no configuration could be found, defaultValue is returned.

briefdescription.para: Returns the context.
Returns a human readable description for this check.

memberdef.argsstring: (const QMap< QString, QgsFeaturePool *> &featurePools, QgsGeometryCheckError *error, int method, const QMap< QString, int > &mergeAttributeIndices, Changes &changes) const
memberdef.name: fixError

briefdescription.para: Fix the error error with the specified method.
Flags for this geometry check.
Returns an id for this check.
Returns if this geometry check is compatible with layer.

detaileddescription.para: By default it checks for the geometry type in compatibleGeometryTypes().

briefdescription.para: Returns a list of descriptions for available resolutions for errors.

detaileddescription.para:
The index will be passed as method to
fixError().
QGIS 3.4

briefdescription.para: Returns all layers and feature ids.

memberdef.argsstring: (const QMap< QString, QgsFeaturePool *> &featurePools, const QString &layerId, QgsFeature &feature, int partIdx, Changes &changes) const

briefdescription.para: Deletes a part of a feature geometry.

memberdef.argsstring: (const QMap< QString, QgsFeaturePool *> &featurePools, const QString &layerId, QgsFeature &feature, int partIdx, QgsAbstractGeometry *newPartGeom, Changes &changes) const
memberdef.name: replaceFeatureGeometryPart

briefdescription.para: Replaces a part in a feature geometry.
Determines the scale factor of a layer to the map coordinate reference system.
This class implements a geometry check.

detaileddescription.para: Geometry checks run over a set of features and can detect errors like topological or other issues which are reported in the geometry validation panel in QGIS and help a user to create valid geometries.
Implementing a custom geometry check consists of the following parts
A new subclass of QgsGeometryCheck needs to be written and at least the following abstract methods need to be implemented:

listitem.para: A list of geometry types to which this check applies
A list of names for (automated) resolution methods that can be used to fix errors of this type
A description for the geometry check.
A unique id for this check.

This method will be called to validate geometries. All geometries which should be validated are passed into this method with the parameter ids and should be retrieved from the available featurePools to make use of caching. New errors should be appended to the error list and other message strings to messages. The method needs to return a tuple (errors, messages).

detaileddescription.para: A Geometry check factory manages meta information for checks. There will always be one single geometry check factory created per check type, but it's possible that multiple QgsGeometryCheck instances are created and used in parallel.
A new subclass of QgsGeometryCheckFactory needs to be written and at least the following abstract methods need to be implemented:

listitem.para: Needs to return a new subclassed QgsGeometryCheck object that has been written in the previous step.
A unique id for this geometry check.
A description for this geometry check that can be presented to the user for more explanation.
Returns a boolean that determines if this check is available for a given layer. This often checks for the geometry type of the layer.
Returns additional flags for a geometry check. If unsure return QgsGeometryCheck.AvailableInValidation.
Returns the type of this geometry check.

detaileddescription.para: Finally the geometry check factory needs to be registered in QGIS, so the system is aware of the available geometry checks.

simplesect.para: This class is a technology preview and unstable API.
